definition: Kit number as provided by the GEM Project Team
Station identifier
Latitude as provided in decimal degrees
Longitude as provided in decimal degrees
Comments associated with the station
Unique number for the sampling event: {kit_nr}_{event_number}
Date of the survey in YYYY-MM-DD
The timezone in which the survey was done
The station_id; has to have an associated entry in stations.csv
Description of the type of cast (single cast, double cast)
Latitude at sampling location as provided in decimal degrees
Longitude at sampling location as provided in decimal degrees
Local time at which the instrument was deployed (HH:MM)
Local time at which the instrument measurements were taken (HH:MM)
Local time at which the water sample was collected (messenger dropped) (HH:MM)
Depth of the targeted sampling event in meters (m).
Abbreviations for crew members responsible for sampling collection
Depth, in meters, of the targeted sampling event
A free text description of the weather on the survey day
Any comments associated with the sampling event
Unique number for the sampling event: {kit_nr}_{event_number}. Has to have a corresponding entry in survey file
Date of the survey in YYYY-MM-DD
Date of the analysis in YYYY-MM-DD
Name of the individual(s) responsible for analysis of the sample
The timezone in which the analysis was done
Sample ID as provided by the Aquafluor
Chlorophyll or turbidity measurement value provided by the Aquafluor
The parameter measured by the Aquafluor. TRB = turbidity, IVCH = In vivo Chlorophyll
Unique string given by participant for the Aquafluor sample ID. Should follow the format: {Sampling Event Number}_{Channel}_{Replicate}
Any comments associated with this measurement
Primary-level flag values: 1 = Good; 2 = Not evaluated, not available, or unknown; 3 = Questionable/suspect; 4 = Bad; 5 = Missing data
Unique number for the sampling event: {kit_nr}_{event_number}. Has to have a corresponding entry in survey file
Date of the survey in YYYY-MM-DD
Time of variable measurement as recorded by the instrument (HH:MM)
Ecological variable measured
Value of the variable measured
Unit of measurement associated with the variable
Unique string given by the participant for the instrument sample ID. Should follow the format: {Sampling Event Number}_{Variable}_{Replicate}
Any comments associated with this measurement
Primary-level flag values: 1 = Good; 2 = Not evaluated, not available, or unknown; 3 = Questionable/suspect; 4 = Bad; 5 = Missing data
